newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish MPs drop censure motion on government.
newsitem.headline: Turkish MPs drop censure motion on government.

text.p: The Turkish parliament on Tuesday dropped an opposition censure motion against the troubled Islamist-led government.
"Putting the censure motion...on the agenda has been rejected," deputy speaker Yasin Hatiboglu said after a vote.
Deputies voted 272 to 265 in favour of dropping the motion brought by the leading opposition Motherland Party, which charged the government with giving civil servants unequal pay rises.

Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan's coalition has faced mounting pressure after a warning from the military about increasing Islamists activities and signs of discontent from the conservative wing of the alliance led by Deputy Prime Minister Tansu Ciller.
However, Ciller earlier told reporters she would not abandon the coalition.
MPs were to vote later on whether to launch an inquiry into Justice Minister Sevket Kazan, a close aide of Erbakan and a member of his Welfare Party, over his Islamist activities.
